widget.d6e89215-5f0a-427d-99e9-971840074da4: Traffic by dst IP and Originating Country

grok_pattern.@value: <%{NUMBER}>%{NUMBER} %{NUMBER:epoch_time} %{WORD:hostname} %{WORD:meraki_log_type} src=%{IP:src} dst=%{IP:dst}( mac=%{MAC:mac})? protocol=%{WORD:protocol}( sport=%{NUMBER:src_port})?( dport=%{NUMBER:dst_port})?( type=%{NUMBER:type})? pattern: %{GREEDYDATA:pattern}

<%{NUMBER}>%{NUMBER} %{NUMBER:epoch_time} %{WORD:hostname} %{WORD:meraki_log_type} src=%{IP:src} dst=%{IP:dst}( mac=%{MAC:mac})? protocol=%{WORD:protocol}( sport=%{NUMBER:src_port})?( dport=%{NUMBER:dst_port})?( type=%{NUMBER:type})? pattern: %{WORD:action} %{GREEDYDATA:pattern}

description.@value: This is the data adapter for AlienVault's Open Threat Exchange platform, containing crowd-sourced IoCs (Indicators of Compromise). For more information see https://otx.alienvault.com. This adapter is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the data adapter for Spamhaus' DROP (Don't Route Or Peer) list, containing netblocks which are "hijacked" or leased by professional spam or cyber-crime operations. For more information see https://www.spamhaus.org/drop. This adapter is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the data adapter for the WHOIS database, listing registered users of Internet resources like IPs, Netblocks or Domain Names. This adapter is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the data adapter for the TOR (The Onion Router) Exit Node List, listing Exit Nodes of the TOR Network . This adapter is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the data adapter for AlienVault's Open Threat Exchange platform, containing crowd-sourced IoCs (Indicators of Compromise). For more information see https://otx.alienvault.com. This adapter is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the cache for AlienVault's Open Threat Exchange platform, containing crowd-sourced IoCs (Indicators of Compromise). For more information see https://otx.alienvault.com. This cache is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the cache for AlienVault's Open Threat Exchange platform, containing crowd-sourced IoCs (Indicators of Compromise). For more information see https://otx.alienvault.com. This cache is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the cache for Spamhaus' (E)DROP (Don't Route Or Peer) list, containing netblocks which are "hijacked" or leased by professional spam or cyber-crime operations. For more information see https://www.spamhaus.org/drop. This cache is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.
Certain downloaded lists do not require caching because they are in memory already and use this no-op cache.

This is the cache for the WHOIS database, listing registered users of Internet resources like IPs, Netblocks or Domain Names. This cache is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the lookup table for the TOR (The Onion Router) Exit Node List, listing Exit Nodes of the TOR Network . This lookup table is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the lookup table for AlienVault's Open Threat Exchange platform, containing crowd-sourced IoCs (Indicators of Compromise). For more information see https://otx.alienvault.com. This lookup table is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the lookup table for Spamhaus' DROP (Don't Route Or Peer) list, containing netblocks which are "hijacked" or leased by professional spam or cyber-crime operations. For more information see https://www.spamhaus.org/drop. This lookup table is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the lookup table for AlienVault's Open Threat Exchange platform, containing crowd-sourced IoCs (Indicators of Compromise). For more information see https://otx.alienvault.com. This lookup table is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

This is the lookup table for the WHOIS database, listing registered users of Internet resources like IPs, Netblocks or Domain Names. This lookup table is used internally by Graylog's Threat Intel Plugin. Do not delete it manually.

source.@value:
pipeline "Inbound-Allowed-Traffic_Tag-w-WhoIs-data"
stage 0 match either
rule "Inbound-allowed-tagwhois"
end

description.@value: Stage 0: set action and traffic direction; Stage 1: Check inbound src address against threat list; Stage 2: if inbound src is a threat, lookup threat details.

source.@value:
pipeline "EET-Set-action-and-traffic_direction"
stage 0 match either
rule "Meraki-firewall_action-update_0-allowinbound"
rule "Meraki-firewall_action-update_1-denyinbound"
rule "Firewall-MatchedRule-Direction-Outbound"
stage 1 match either
rule "GLR-Threat_Intel_Lookup_src_address"
stage 2 match either
rule "ThreatIntellOTX:Inbound - src"
end

rule "Meraki-firewall_action-update_0-allowinbound"
when
  ( has_field("meraki_log_type") &&
lowercase(to_string($message."meraki_log_type")) == lowercase("firewall")
)

  AND
  ( has_field("action") &&
to_string($message."action") == "0"
)

then
  set_field(
    field : "action",
    value : "allow"
  );
  set_field(
    field : "src-dst-direction",
    value : "inbound",
    default : "broken-pipeline",
    clean_field : true
  );
end

rule "Threat Intelligence Lookups: dst_addr"
when
 has_field("dst")
then
 set_fields(threat_intel_lookup_ip(to_string($message.dst_addr), "dst_addr"));
end

rule "Meraki-firewall_action-update_1-denyinbound"
when
  ( has_field("meraki_log_type") &&
to_string($message."meraki_log_type") == "firewall"
)

  AND
  ( has_field("action") &&
to_string($message."action") == "1"
)

then
  set_field(
    field : "action",
    value : "deny"
  );
  set_field(
    field : "src-dst-direction",
    value : "inbound",
    default : "broken-pipeline",
    clean_field : true
  );
end

description.@value: Add a tag of "outbound" to logs matching an outbound rule

source.@value:
rule "Firewall-MatchedRule-Direction-Outbound"
when
  ( has_field("action") &&
lowercase(to_string($message."action")) == lowercase("allow")
)

  OR
  ( has_field("action") &&
lowercase(to_string($message."action")) == lowercase("deny")
)

then
  set_field(
    field : "src-dst-direction",
    value : "outbound",
    default : "broken-pipeline",
    clean_field : true
  );
end

rule "ThreatIntelLookup:Inbound - src_addr v01"
when
  has_field(
    field : "src"
  )
  AND
  ( has_field("src-dst-direction") &&
lowercase(to_string($message."src-dst-direction")) == lowercase("inbound")
)

then
 set_fields(threat_intel_lookup_ip(to_string($message.src_addr), "src_addr"));
end

rule "Threat Intelligence Lookups: src_addr"
when
 has_field("src")
then
 set_fields(threat_intel_lookup_ip(to_string($message.src_addr), "src_addr"));
end

rule "Threat Intelligence Lookups: domain"
when
 has_field("domain")
then
 set_fields(threat_intel_lookup_domain(to_string($message.domain), "domain"));
end

rule "ThreatIntelLookup:Outbound - dst_addr v01"
when
 has_field(
    field: "dst"
 )
 AND
 ( has_field("src-dst-direction") && 
lowercase(to_string($message."src-dst-direction")) == "outbound"
 )
then
 set_fields(threat_intel_lookup_ip(to_string($message.dst_addr), "dst_addr"));
end

description.@value: If hostname is "Atglen_Firewall" send to meraki index
